concept.title: Quick Start Step 6:
concept.shortdesc: You can easily take down your instances and security groups on .

stentry.p: To administer and troubleshoot your cluster, you can connect to it using SSH and then run commands. To connect, specify the IP address of your core and the location of your RSA private key, for example:ssh ubuntu@203.0.113.0 -i ~/.ssh/myPrivateKey.pem
stentry.b: Terminating Instances and Security Groups from the Command Line
stentry.p: To terminate your instance and its security groups, run the following command and enter yes when prompted:
stentry.note: This action will delete all of your managed infrastructure and it cannot be undone. For more information, see the Terraform documentation on Command: Destroy.
For more information, see Terraform Variables.
stentry.p: Terraform cleanly terminates the instance and the security groups associated with it.
stentry.note: If the destroy process enters a loop, delete the terraform.tfstate file and run the command again.
stentry.b: To Terminate Instances and Security Groups from
stentry.p: Using to terminate instances or security groups is not recommended. Use the following steps only if you run into difficulties with Terraform.

ol.li: Click the checkbox next to your instance, for example hcf-core.
Click Project Compute Access and Security .
Click the checkbox next to your security group, for example hcf-container-host.
